title: Top 5 Slovakia Tourist Attractions To See
text:
Home > Travel Destinations > Top 5 Slovakia Tourist Attractions To See Top 5 Slovakia Tourist Attractions To See By admin on October 5, 2015 
If you are fond of mountains, folk architecture, ski resorts and natural landscapes then Slovakia is just the perfect place for your holiday. Every year millions of people visit Slovakia a major portion of which hails from Czech Republic. Top Slovakia Tourist Attractions 
Some of the Slovakia tourist attractions that are sure to make your stay a memorable and enjoyable one are as follows. Bratislava 
Bratislava is the capital Danube and is known as the crowning city of the Hungarian Kings. Its pulsating and energetic life is sure to revitalize you. Long walks across the city center and a sip of hot coffee inside the cozy cafes are rue to make your travel a worthwhile memory. 
The Altitude Restaurant situated in the TV Tower is worth mentioning because if its mesmerizing view. Some of the best Slovakia tourist attractions in Bratislava to visit include Bratislava Castle, Michael’s Gate, Primate’s Palace, Hviezdoslavovo námestie, Eurovea, and view of Danube River by night. Kosice 
Kosice is one of the popular Slovakia tourist attractions and it also ranks second biggest city in Slovakia. It has a unique feel and has several prominent landmarks. 
Kosice is bestowed with the largest church known as St. Elisabeth Cathedral that can be found in Slovakia with a capacity of five thousand plus. It was named as the European Capital of Culture. 
During this phase different kinds of cultural stalls were made available along with long term programs which are running till date. Some of the best places to visit in Kosice include Main Street, Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Kosice, Kosice State Theater, St. Michael Chapel, St. Urban Tower, etc Caves Of The Slovak Karst 
Beside the cultural treasures and natural beauties, you can also explore the caves in Slovakia. Even though Slovakia is relatively, a small place but has huge collection of caves which are easily accessible by the public. 
They are maintained on a regular basis along with beautiful decorations. You can find caves ranging from limestone structure, ice decorations as well as aragonite decorations. Spa Town – Piestany 
After the daylong exploration, you can relax and enjoy in Slovak spas out of which the most popular one is located in Piestany. This place is located in beautiful valley of the River Vah.It is just around 80kilometres away from Bratislava. 
You can choose between healing mud and monumental hotels situated within natural parks. Best part of these pools used for spa is that they contain Sulfate-Carbonate water from springs are used Spis Castle 
Ruins of Spis Castle is one of the must to visit Slovakia tourist attractions. These ruins of this castle are one of the largest Castle sites located in Central Europe. This castle also occupies place in UNESCO list of World Heritage Sites.
